page.content: Some of the vociferous and nasal comments of the day were{absolutley {poisonous,abominable,a fearful smell} Today,in 1985,there is still a nip in the air around the actual sewage works But there's more to Esholt than meets the nose.In 1862 Bradford's first sewer was built.Until then there were lots of diseases-cholera,smallpox, typhoid.Yet the river pollution got worse as the textile industry grew.12 years later Bradford Corporation began sewage treatment in Frizinghall,but there was too much waste to cope with.
